text: Hans Knauß (born 9 February 1971 in Schladming) is an Austrian former alpine skier. He competed at the 1994, 1998 and 2002 Winter Olympics, winning a silver medal in the Super-G at the 1998 Nagano Olympics. Knauß tested positive for the anabolic steroid Nandrolone at a World Cup downhill in Canada on 27 November 2004 and was given an 18-month ban from sport. == Doping ban == Knauß tested positive for the anabolic steroid Nandrolone at a World Cup downhill in Lake Louise in Canada on 27 November 2004 and was subsequently given an 18-month ban from sport.Highest sporting court denies appeal of Hans Knauss in doping suspension, skiracing.com, 22 July 2005 Knauß retired from the sport after the doping sanction. ==World Cup victories== {| class="wikitable" |- !Date ! title: Hans Knauß
